intro: Iranecio lipskyi, commonly known as the Lipseky's iris, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, temperate climate to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
